intro: Morelosia guildingiana, commonly known as the Guilding's morelosia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and violet. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Its foliage consists of palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, contributing to its ornamental value.
